page.title: 09Majorettes-Chickerell.
page.content: {Majorettes are people who twirl {batons.}A baton is a metal stick with rubber at each end. Majotettes march around in a hall and do{dance {routines. In Chickerell}there are the {"Bluebelle Majorettes".}Their uniform is blue and white and they train on Tuesday, Wednesday and Friday evenings. There is a{Junior troupe {and a Senior troupe.}You have to be {12 years of age to be in the Senior {troupe.}The{lead girl}is called the {'Mace'.}There is a 'Mace' and ten other girls in the Juniors and in the seniors there is a 'Mace' and twelve girls. We have{won 98 trophies in all.}In April 1985 we went to Butlin's Holiday Camp and won there and we went to Cornwall for the weekend and won there as well. On Sat. 16th June 1985 we went to Bournemouth and won 3 trophies
